meanings.definition: Lack of harmony or elegance in appearance or manner.
meanings.sent1: The room's inconcinnity was evident in the mismatched furniture and chaotic decor.
meanings.sent2: Her outfit displayed a clear inconcinnity with its clashing colors and patterns.
meanings.sent3: The inconcinnity of his dance moves made everyone giggle at the party.
meanings.sent4: The inconcinnity between his formal speech and casual attire was like a jarring melody.
meanings.sent5: The inconcinnity of the painting's colors created a jumbled and unappealing image.

meanings.sent1: The inconcinnity of wearing flip-flops to a formal event was obvious.
meanings.sent2: His jokes had an inconcinnity that didn't match the somber mood of the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The inconcinnity of using a fork to eat soup made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The inconcinnity of her loud laughter during the solemn ceremony was like a misplaced note.
meanings.sent5: The inconcinnity of his choice of words in that situation was cringeworthy.

meanings.sent1: The inconcinnity in his story was evident when the details kept changing.
meanings.sent2: The inconcinnity between his promises and actions was disappointing.
meanings.sent3: The inconcinnity of the weather forecast made planning a picnic difficult.
meanings.sent4: The inconcinnity in her behavior left everyone puzzled.
meanings.sent5: The inconcinnity of the puzzle pieces not fitting together frustrated the child.
